intro: Mikania copayensis, commonly known as the Copayá vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Mikania copayensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
